leaf_cluster_name: 环境-污染/生态建模与监测生态
task_chain: 采集→清洗→预测/告警→解释→报告
tool_form: 时序库 + 监控 + 可视化

tools.name: SSSD
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based time series imputation and forecasting model
tools.detailed_description: A structured state space model (SSSD) implementation for time series imputation and forecasting, utilizing diffusion models to handle missing data in healthcare and environmental datasets.

tools.name: Agrolib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for agrometeorological modeling and climate analysis
tools.detailed_description: A set of C++ libraries for agrometeorological modeling, including numerical solutions for soil water/heat flow, water balance, meteorological data interpolation, and plant development simulation.

tools.name: mSSA
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis for time series
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis (mSSA) for forecasting and imputation of multivariate time series data, suitable for environmental sensor streams.

tools.name: DiffAD
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based anomaly detection for time series
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Imputation-based Time-Series Anomaly Detection with Conditional Weight-Incremental Diffusion Models', providing a generative approach to identify anomalies in sensor data.

tools.name: FedIoT
tools.one_line_profile: Federated learning framework for IoT anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A federated learning framework designed for on-device anomaly detection in Internet of Things (IoT) environments, enabling privacy-preserving model training across distributed sensors.

tools.name: pyodi
tools.one_line_profile: Python tool for object detection dataset analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool to analyze and visualize object detection datasets, useful for quality control and insights in image-based environmental monitoring (e.g., camera traps).

tools.name: GRIN
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Networks for multivariate time series imputation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Filling the G_ap_s', a method using Graph Neural Networks to reconstruct missing data in multivariate time series by leveraging spatial-temporal dependencies.

tools.name: SaQC
tools.one_line_profile: System for Automated Quality Control of time series data
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by Helmholtz-UFZ for the automated quality control and processing of time series data, specifically designed for environmental monitoring networks.

tools.name: GAN-RNN_Timeseries-imputation
tools.one_line_profile: Recurrent GAN for time series imputation
tools.detailed_description: A Recurrent Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) implementation designed to impute missing values in time series data, applicable to sensor data cleaning.

tools.name: MTSCI
tools.one_line_profile: Conditional Diffusion Model for time series imputation
tools.detailed_description: Source code for MTSCI, a conditional diffusion model designed for consistent imputation in incomplete time series data.

tools.name: Multivariate-Time-Series-Imputation-GAN
tools.one_line_profile: GAN-based multivariate time series imputation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) approach for imputing missing values in multivariate time series data (NIPS 2018 paper).

tools.name: datastream.io
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time anomaly detection framework
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for real-time anomaly detection on data streams using Python, ElasticSearch, and Kibana, suitable for monitoring sensor networks.

tools.name: HIVE-OS
tools.one_line_profile: Data processing workflow for converting beehive health and Earth observation data
tools.detailed_description: A software tool developed to ingest raw beehive health data, convert it into spatial GeoJSON formats, and interface with Google Earth Engine to correlate health metrics with environmental and atmospheric phenomena derived from NASA Earth observations.

tools.name: Nixtla SDK (TimeGPT)
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for TimeGPT foundation model for time series forecasting and anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A production-ready library providing access to TimeGPT, a generative pre-trained transformer for time series. It enables forecasting and anomaly detection across various domains including IoT and environmental monitoring.

tools.name: skchange
tools.one_line_profile: Change detection and anomaly detection algorithms for time series
tools.detailed_description: A library providing sktime-compatible algorithms for change detection and changepoint-based anomaly detection in time series data, useful for monitoring environmental sensor streams.

tools.name: PyODM
tools.one_line_profile: Python SDK for OpenDroneMap aerial image processing
tools.detailed_description: A Python software development kit for interfacing with OpenDroneMap, enabling the integration of aerial image processing and photogrammetry capabilities into applications for environmental monitoring and mapping.

tools.name: RADAR-IoT
tools.one_line_profile: IoT framework for sensor data collection in the RADAR-base platform
tools.detailed_description: The IoT component of the RADAR-base platform, designed to facilitate the integration and management of Internet of Things devices for collecting sensor data in health and environmental monitoring contexts.

tools.name: alibi-detect
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for outlier, adversarial, and drift detection
tools.detailed_description: A Python library focused on outlier detection, adversarial detection, and concept drift detection, applicable to monitoring data quality and consistency in scientific time series and sensor data.

tools.name: simulariatools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for preprocessing and postprocessing air quality data
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing utilities to preprocess meteorological data and post-process results for air quality assessment models (e.g., CALMET/CALPUFF), developed by Simularia.

tools.name: imputeTS
tools.one_line_profile: Time series missing value imputation library
tools.detailed_description: A CRAN R package dedicated to imputing missing values in time series data, offering various algorithms to handle gaps in sensor or environmental datasets.

tools.name: sensortoolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Air sensor data analysis library by US EPA
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by the U.S. EPA for evaluating and analyzing data from air quality sensors, including functions for data ingestion, quality control, and performance evaluation.

tools.name: GEMPAK
tools.one_line_profile: Meteorological data analysis and product generation package
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive analysis and product generation package for meteorological data, widely used for decoding, analyzing, and visualizing weather data.

tools.name: PyPOTS
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for partially-observed time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python toolkit for data mining on partially-observed time series, providing state-of-the-art neural network models for imputation, classification, clustering, forecasting, and anomaly detection.

tools.name: SAITS
tools.one_line_profile: Self-Attention-based Imputation for Time Series
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the SAITS model for efficient imputation of missing values in multivariate time series using self-attention mechanisms. Can be used as a standalone tool or via PyPOTS.

tools.name: TSDB
tools.one_line_profile: Time Series Data Base for loading public datasets
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox designed to easily load and manage open-source time series datasets for machine learning and deep learning benchmarking, covering domains like weather, power, and healthcare.

tools.name: featuretools-tsfresh-primitives
tools.one_line_profile: TSFresh primitives integration for Featuretools
tools.detailed_description: A library that exposes TSFresh's time series feature extraction capabilities as primitives within the Featuretools ecosystem, facilitating automated feature engineering for time series data.

tools.name: airflow-provider-anomaly-detection
tools.one_line_profile: Airflow provider for anomaly detection tasks
tools.detailed_description: An Apache Airflow provider package that enables the integration of anomaly detection tasks (e.g., using various SQL or metric checks) directly into data pipelines.

tools.name: adtk
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly Detection Toolkit for time series
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for rule-based and unsupervised anomaly detection in time series, providing a set of detectors and transformers to handle common anomalies in sensor and operational data.

tools.name: pyodeint
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for boost::numeric::odeint
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper around the C++ boost::numeric::odeint library, providing fast numerical integration for ordinary differential equations, essential for dynamic system modeling.

tools.name: pyodesys
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical integration of systems of ODEs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for straightforward numerical integration of systems of ordinary differential equations, supporting symbolic representation and multiple backend solvers.

tools.name: tsfresh
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic extraction of relevant features from time series
tools.detailed_description: A powerful Python package that automatically calculates a large number of time series characteristics (features) for use in machine learning pipelines, widely used for analyzing sensor data.

tools.name: rankpruning
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithm for binary classification with noisy labels (predecessor to Cleanlab)
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of rank pruning for learning with noisy labels in binary classification tasks. While now largely superseded by the Cleanlab library, it provides specific algorithms for identifying label errors.

tools.name: cleanlab
tools.one_line_profile: Standard data-centric AI package for data quality and label error detection
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for data-centric AI, focusing on automatically detecting and correcting errors in datasets (such as label noise) and improving machine learning model performance on messy, real-world data.

tools.name: cleanlab-codex
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for integrating Cleanlab Codex with AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A client library enabling the integration of Cleanlab's Codex data quality tools into AI agents and workflows, facilitating automated data curation.

tools.name: cleanlab-studio
tools.one_line_profile: Python client interface for Cleanlab Studio
tools.detailed_description: The official Python client for interacting with Cleanlab Studio, a platform for automated data correction and model improvement.

tools.name: cleanlab-tlm
tools.one_line_profile: Client library for Cleanlab Trustworthy Language Model
tools.detailed_description: A Python client for accessing Cleanlab's Trustworthy Language Model (TLM), which provides reliability scores and hallucination detection for LLM outputs.

tools.name: NCDSSM
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Continuous-Discrete State Space Models for irregular time series
tools.detailed_description: PyTorch implementation of Neural Continuous-Discrete State Space Models (NCDSSM), designed for modeling and imputing irregularly-sampled time series data.

tools.name: pyodds
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end outlier detection system
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python system for outlier detection, supporting full-stack operations from database interaction to algorithm execution and visualization.

tools.name: AutoImpute
tools.one_line_profile: Autoencoder-based imputation for single-cell RNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool using autoencoders to impute missing values (dropouts) in single-cell RNA sequencing data, improving downstream analysis.

tools.name: DQOps
tools.one_line_profile: Data quality and observability platform
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform for data quality monitoring and observability, allowing users to define checks, detect anomalies, and monitor data health across the lifecycle.

tools.name: ImputeGAP
tools.one_line_profile: Library of imputation techniques for time series data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library providing various algorithms and techniques for imputing missing values in time series data, developed by eXascale Infolab.

tools.name: luftdatenpumpe
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to acquire and process air quality data
tools.detailed_description: A utility to fetch, filter, and process live and historical air quality data from sources like Sensor.Community and OpenAQ, supporting storage and visualization.

tools.name: CSDI
tools.one_line_profile: Conditional Score-based Diffusion Models for time series imputation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of CSDI, a probabilistic model using score-based diffusion for imputing missing values in time series data.

tools.name: smartcitizen-data
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for analyzing environmental sensor data
tools.detailed_description: A library developed by Fab Lab Barcelona for analyzing and processing data from Smart Citizen environmental sensors.

tools.name: prophetverse
tools.one_line_profile: Multiverse of Prophet models for time series forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A library extending the Prophet forecasting model, providing a collection of models and utilities for time series analysis and prediction.

tools.name: pyodk
tools.one_line_profile: Official Python library for ODK (Open Data Kit)
tools.detailed_description: The official Python client for ODK, enabling programmatic access to ODK Central for retrieving and managing data collected via ODK forms (widely used in field research).

tools.name: hcrystalball
tools.one_line_profile: Unified API for time-series forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A library that unifies the API for various time-series forecasting libraries (like sklearn, prophet, etc.) to simplify model selection and execution.

tools.name: SSIM_Seq2Seq
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning approach for recovering missing time series sensor data
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based solver implementing SSIM (Seq2Seq Imputation) for reconstructing missing values in time series sensor data, useful for environmental monitoring and sensor networks.

tools.name: tslib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for time series forecasting and imputation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing algorithms for time series analysis, specifically focusing on forecasting future values and imputing missing data points in sensor or observational datasets.

tools.name: autoimpute
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for analysis and imputation of missing data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides a variety of methods for handling missing data in datasets, including time series, supporting analysis and imputation workflows.

tools.name: FLK-NN
tools.one_line_profile: Time series imputation using lagged correlations
tools.detailed_description: A solver for imputing missing values in time series data by leveraging lagged correlations, developed by the Kleinberg Lab.

tools.name: MTSIT
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Time Series Imputation with Transformers
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Transformer-based approach for imputing missing values in multivariate time series data, useful for complex sensor datasets.

tools.name: V-RIN
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty-Aware Variational-Recurrent Imputation Network
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for time series imputation that incorporates uncertainty estimation, suitable for handling noisy sensor or clinical time series data.

tools.name: NRTSI
tools.one_line_profile: Non-Recurrent Time Series Imputation
tools.detailed_description: A non-recurrent neural network approach for imputing missing values in time series, offering an alternative to RNN-based methods for data cleaning.

tools.name: TITAN
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic data quality control software for meteorology
tools.detailed_description: A software package for automatic quality control (QC) of meteorological data, developed by the Norwegian Meteorological Institute, handling spatial and temporal checks.

tools.name: microprediction
tools.one_line_profile: Client for open time series prediction and imputation
tools.detailed_description: A library and client for the Microprediction platform, facilitating crowd-sourced time series forecasting and imputation, useful for analyzing sensor streams.

tools.name: UniTS
tools.one_line_profile: Unified multi-task time series foundation model
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model for time series analysis capable of handling multiple tasks including forecasting, imputation, and classification across diverse domains.

tools.name: MOMENT
tools.one_line_profile: Family of open time-series foundation models
tools.detailed_description: A family of foundation models designed for general-purpose time series analysis, including imputation, forecasting, and anomaly detection.

tools.name: skpro
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic regression and survival analysis framework
tools.detailed_description: A unified framework for tabular probabilistic regression, time-to-event prediction, and probability distributions in Python, compatible with the scikit-learn ecosystem. It provides interfaces for probabilistic modeling which is essential for uncertainty estimation in environmental monitoring.

tools.name: sktime
tools.one_line_profile: Unified framework for time series machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for time series analysis in Python, providing unified interfaces for forecasting, classification, regression, clustering, and annotation tasks. It is widely used for processing sensor data and environmental time series.

tools.name: Time-Series-Library
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for advanced time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source library implementing state-of-the-art deep learning models for time series forecasting, imputation, classification, and anomaly detection. It serves as a benchmark and toolkit for time series research.

tools.name: Darts
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly time series forecasting and anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for easy manipulation and forecasting of time series, supporting a variety of models from ARIMA to deep neural networks. It simplifies the pipeline for time series processing and analysis.

tools.name: PyOD
tools.one_line_profile: A comprehensive Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects in multivariate data
tools.detailed_description: PyOD is a comprehensive and scalable Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects in multivariate data. It includes more than 30 detection algorithms, ranging from classical techniques like LOF (Local Outlier Factor) to deep learning models like AutoEncoders. It is widely used for data cleaning, quality control, and anomaly detection in scientific time-series and sensor data.

tools.name: Flow Forecast
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for time series forecasting and anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning PyTorch library specifically designed for time series forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection, with a focus on flood forecasting and environmental data.

tools.name: CRITERIA3D
tools.one_line_profile: Three-dimensional agro-hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: A three-dimensional agro-hydrological model for small catchments, simulating water flow and transport in soil and plants.

tools.name: Raven Hydrological Modelling Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible and modular hydrological modelling framework
tools.detailed_description: A robust hydrological modelling framework that allows for the discretization of watersheds and simulation of hydrological processes using various algorithms.

tools.name: RavenPy
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Raven hydrological framework
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper designed to facilitate the setup, execution, and analysis of the Raven hydrological modelling framework.

tools.name: Canadian Hydrological Model (CHM)
tools.one_line_profile: Modular, multi-physics, spatially distributed hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: A modular, multi-physics, spatially distributed hydrological model designed for cold-region hydrological processes and snow modeling.

tools.name: pywatershed
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrologic model in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for hydrologic modeling, designed to modernize and replace legacy Fortran-based models like PRMS.

tools.name: HyperTS
tools.one_line_profile: Full-Pipeline Automated Time Series (AutoTS) Analysis Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python toolkit for automated time series analysis, including forecasting, classification, and regression, designed to simplify the machine learning pipeline for time-series data.

tools.name: Visual-HEIFLOW
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical modeling environment for integrated hydrological modeling
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive graphical user interface and modeling environment for HEIFLOW, facilitating integrated hydrological modeling and visualization.

tools.name: Wflow.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package for hydrological modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that provides a framework for distributed hydrological modeling, allowing for rapid development and deployment of hydrological models.

tools.name: DGDM
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic Weather Forecasting with Deterministic Guidance-based Diffusion Model
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a diffusion model-based approach for probabilistic weather forecasting, leveraging deterministic guidance to improve prediction accuracy.

tools.name: CorrSTN
tools.one_line_profile: Correlation information-based spatiotemporal network for traffic flow forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model designed for traffic flow forecasting that incorporates correlation information to capture spatiotemporal dependencies.

tools.name: ManyFEWS
tools.one_line_profile: The Many Flood Early Warning System
tools.detailed_description: A flood early warning system developed by Durham University's Advanced Research Computing, designed to provide alerts and monitoring for flood risks.

tools.name: CLCRN
tools.one_line_profile: Conditional Local Convolution for Spatio-temporal Meteorological Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: PyTorch implementation of the CLCRN model for spatio-temporal meteorological forecasting, as presented at AAAI 2022.

tools.name: BiodiversityTools
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial biodiversity modelling tools by NSW DCCEEW
tools.detailed_description: A suite of spatial biodiversity modelling tools and code developed by the Metrics and Forecasting Ecological Modelling Team at NSW DCCEEW.

tools.name: KAT
tools.one_line_profile: K-mer Analysis Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for analyzing and comparing K-mer spectra from DNA sequencing data, useful for quality control and genomic analysis.

tools.name: ST-SSL
tools.one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal Self-Supervised Learning for Traffic Flow Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a self-supervised learning framework for spatio-temporal traffic flow forecasting.

tools.name: ecoforecastR
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical and informatic tools for ecological forecasting in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing general statistical and informatic tools specifically designed for ecological forecasting applications.

tools.name: epidemiar
tools.one_line_profile: R package for EPIDEMIA forecasting system
tools.detailed_description: An R package containing modeling, forecasting, and early warning tools for the EPIDEMIA system, integrating surveillance and environmental data for disease forecasting.

tools.name: HighAir
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical Graph Neural Network-Based Air Quality Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: Source code for HighAir, a method using hierarchical graph neural networks for forecasting air quality.

tools.name: SPHY
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial Processes in HYdrology hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: A hydrological modeling tool that simulates spatial processes in hydrology, suitable for water resource management and climate impact assessment.

tools.name: gis4wrf
tools.one_line_profile: QGIS toolkit for Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model
tools.detailed_description: A QGIS plugin that provides tools for pre- and post-processing, visualization, and running simulations with the WRF model.

tools.name: grin
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Time Series Imputation by Graph Neural Networks
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the GRIN model for filling gaps in multivariate time series data using Graph Neural Networks.

tools.name: Pangu-Weather-ReadyToGo
tools.one_line_profile: Unofficial workflow for Huawei's Pangu Weather Model inference and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A complete workflow implementation for the Pangu-Weather global weather forecasting model. It provides tools for input data preparation, model inference, result conversion, and visualization, enabling researchers to deploy and test the Pangu-Weather model.

tools.name: EF5
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble Framework For Flash Flood Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A hydrological modelling framework designed for flash flood forecasting. It provides an ensemble approach to simulate and predict flood events, supporting research in hydrology and disaster management.

tools.name: topmodel
tools.one_line_profile: R package implementation of the TOPMODEL hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing the TOPMODEL (TOPography based hydrological MODEL), a semi-distributed hydrological model. It is used for rainfall-runoff modelling and understanding hydrological processes based on topography.

tools.name: Hy2DL
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid Hydrological modeling using Deep Learning methods
tools.detailed_description: A library for hybrid hydrological modeling that integrates deep learning methods with traditional hydrological concepts. Developed by KIT-HYD, it aims to improve hydrological predictions by leveraging the strengths of both data-driven and process-based approaches.

tools.name: hydrate
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to setup and run hydrologic models using Earth Engine data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the setup and execution of hydrologic models by automatically retrieving and processing necessary data from Google Earth Engine. It simplifies the workflow for hydrological modeling.

tools.name: WRF-IBM
tools.one_line_profile: WRF model extended with Immersed Boundary Method
tools.detailed_description: A version of the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model that incorporates the Immersed Boundary Method (IBM). This extension allows for more accurate simulations of atmospheric flows over complex terrain and urban environments.

tools.name: Multivariate-Time-Series-Imputation-with-Generative-Adversarial-Networks
tools.one_line_profile: GAN-based imputation for multivariate time series data
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) framework designed to impute missing values in multivariate time series data, useful for preprocessing environmental sensor data.

tools.name: MODFLOW 6
tools.one_line_profile: USGS Modular Hydrologic Model for groundwater flow
tools.detailed_description: The USGS Modular Hydrologic Model (MODFLOW 6) is a standard code for simulating groundwater flow and transport, supporting structured and unstructured grids.

tools.name: STGM
tools.one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer for traffic forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model (Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer) designed for forecasting traffic flow, which serves as a proxy for mobile source emission estimation in environmental modeling.

tools.name: pi-wrf
tools.one_line_profile: Running WRF weather model on Raspberry Pi
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter notebook based application that facilitates running the Weather Research and Forecasting Model (WRF) on Raspberry Pi devices for educational and edge-computing weather modeling.

tools.name: wrf-python
tools.one_line_profile: Diagnostic and interpolation routines for WRF-ARW model output
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing a collection of diagnostic and interpolation routines for post-processing and analyzing output data from the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF-ARW) Model.

tools.name: DARTS (Medical)
tools.one_line_profile: DenseUnet-based tool for brain segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A DenseUnet-based Automatic Rapid Tool for brain Segmentation, providing a deep learning solution for medical image analysis.

tools.name: GDM
tools.one_line_profile: Early-warning signals of disintegration in complex systems
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing machine learning dismantling and early-warning signals for analyzing the disintegration of complex systems/networks.

tools.name: statsforecast
tools.one_line_profile: Fast forecasting with statistical and econometric models
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for lightning-fast time series forecasting using statistical and econometric models, widely used for environmental and economic time series analysis.

tools.name: ODMToolsPython
tools.one_line_profile: Data management for Observations Data Model (ODM)
tools.detailed_description: A Python application for querying, visualizing, and editing environmental observational data stored in an Observations Data Model (ODM) database.

tools.name: Prophet_Explore
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive interface for Facebook Prophet
tools.detailed_description: A Shiny App that provides an interactive GUI to explore and visualize the functions and forecasts of the Prophet time series forecasting package.

tools.name: Raven
tools.one_line_profile: WPS services for hydrological modeling
tools.detailed_description: Web Processing Services (WPS) wrapper for hydrological modeling capabilities, facilitating the integration of hydrology models into web workflows.

tools.name: hydrodataset
tools.one_line_profile: Downloader and reader for hydrologic datasets
tools.detailed_description: A utility library for downloading, reading, and processing common datasets used in hydrological modeling (e.g., CAMELS).

tools.name: torchhydro
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning models for watershed hydrology
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library providing datasets and deep learning models specifically designed for watershed hydrological modeling.

tools.name: Ozon3
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time and historical air quality data fetcher
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to easily obtain real-time, historical, or forecasted air quality data for locations worldwide.

tools.name: point-cloud-prediction
tools.one_line_profile: Self-supervised point cloud prediction
tools.detailed_description: A library for self-supervised prediction of 3D point clouds using Spatio-temporal Convolutional Networks, applicable in robotics and environmental sensing.

tools.name: PEcAn
tools.one_line_profile: Predictive Ecosystem Analyzer toolbox
tools.detailed_description: The Predictive Ecosystem Analyzer (PEcAn) is an integrated ecological bioinformatics toolbox for ecosystem modeling, data analysis, and forecasting.

tools.name: SED-EEW-SeisComP-contributions
tools.one_line_profile: Libraries and modules for Earthquake Early Warning (EEW) integrated with SeisComP
tools.detailed_description: A collection of libraries and modules developed by the Swiss Seismological Service (SED) at ETH Zurich for the SeisComP seismological software system. It focuses on Earthquake Early Warning (EEW) capabilities, providing algorithms and tools for real-time seismic monitoring and alert generation.

tools.name: SHUD
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for Hydrologic Unstructured Domains (SHUD) - Integrated Hydrological Model
tools.detailed_description: SHUD is a multi-scale, multi-process, integrated hydrological model that uses the semi-discrete finite volume method. It simulates surface and subsurface flow, evapotranspiration, and river routing in unstructured domains, suitable for catchment-scale hydrological modeling.

tools.name: SORMAS
tools.one_line_profile: Surveillance, Outbreak Response Management and Analysis System
tools.detailed_description: SORMAS is an open-source mobile and web application for the management of disease control and outbreak response. It provides tools for early warning, surveillance, and analysis of infectious disease spread, facilitating real-time data exchange between health workers.

tools.name: VICmodel
tools.one_line_profile: R implementation of the Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements the Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) model, a large-scale, semi-distributed hydrologic model. It allows researchers to run VIC simulations and analyze hydrological processes such as infiltration, runoff, and evaporation directly within the R environment.

tools.name: TerraMA2
tools.one_line_profile: Computational platform for environmental early warning systems
tools.detailed_description: TerraMA² is a free and open-source software platform designed for developing early warning systems for environmental risks such as floods, fires, and landslides. It integrates data collection, monitoring, analysis, and alert dissemination.

tools.name: PCR-GLOBWB
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale global hydrology and water balance model
tools.detailed_description: A grid-based global hydrological model that simulates the water balance at a daily time step. It calculates water storage in various compartments (soil, groundwater, surface water) and water exchange between them, intended for global to regional studies on water availability and stress.

tools.name: VIC
tools.one_line_profile: Macroscale hydrologic model for water and energy balance simulation
tools.detailed_description: The Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) model is a large-scale, semi-distributed hydrologic model that solves full water and energy balances. It is widely used for simulating streamflow, soil moisture, and other hydrologic variables in response to climate and weather inputs.

tools.name: tonic
tools.one_line_profile: Pre/post-processing toolbox for hydrologic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed to facilitate the pre-processing of inputs and post-processing of outputs for hydrologic models, specifically supporting the VIC model ecosystem. It includes utilities for grid transformation, parameter handling, and data visualization.

tools.name: AgML-CY-Bench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for crop yield forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark dataset and standardization framework for forecasting crop yields at the subnational level. It harmonizes public yield statistics with climate and remote sensing predictors to facilitate machine learning research in agriculture.

tools.name: DARTS (RNA-seq)
tools.one_line_profile: Deep-learning Augmented RNA-seq analysis of Transcript Splicing
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework for predicting transcript splicing from RNA-seq data. It leverages deep neural networks to augment standard RNA-seq analysis, improving the detection of alternative splicing events.

tools.name: prophet-ruby
tools.one_line_profile: Ruby client for the Prophet time series forecasting procedure
tools.detailed_description: A Ruby wrapper for Facebook's Prophet library, enabling time series forecasting with additive models for trends and seasonality in Ruby applications.

tools.name: streamlit_prophet
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based application to train, evaluate, and optimize Prophet forecasting models
tools.detailed_description: A Streamlit-based graphical interface for the Prophet forecasting library, allowing users to visually train models, evaluate performance, and optimize parameters without writing code.

tools.name: GluonTS
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic time series modeling library based on deep learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for probabilistic time series modeling, providing state-of-the-art deep learning models for forecasting and anomaly detection.

tools.name: PyTorch Geometric Temporal
tools.one_line_profile: Temporal extension library for PyTorch Geometric for spatiotemporal signal processing
tools.detailed_description: A temporal extension library for PyTorch Geometric, designed for spatiotemporal signal processing and dynamic graph neural networks, widely used in traffic and environmental forecasting.

tools.name: PROPhet
tools.one_line_profile: Tool integrating machine learning with first-principles quantum chemistry approaches
tools.detailed_description: A code designed to integrate machine learning techniques with first-principles quantum chemistry approaches for property prediction and modeling.

tools.name: modeltime
tools.one_line_profile: R framework for time series forecasting and machine learning integration
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive R framework that integrates classical time series models and machine learning algorithms for forecasting, streamlining the workflow of model training and evaluation.

tools.name: modeltime.gluonts
tools.one_line_profile: GluonTS deep learning backend for the Modeltime forecasting framework
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the Modeltime framework that provides a backend for GluonTS, enabling the use of deep learning probabilistic forecasting models within the R ecosystem.

tools.name: pyflowline
tools.one_line_profile: Mesh-independent river network generator for hydrologic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for generating mesh-independent river networks, designed to support hydrologic modeling simulations.

tools.name: pyhexwatershed
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for the HexWatershed flow direction model
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface for HexWatershed, a mesh-independent flow direction model used in hydrologic simulations and watershed analysis.

tools.name: CREST-iMAP
tools.one_line_profile: Coupled hydrologic and hydrodynamic modeling framework
tools.detailed_description: A coupled hydrologic and hydrodynamic modeling framework designed for flood forecasting and water resource management.

tools.name: HydroCNHS
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrological model package for coupled natural-human systems
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing hydrological modeling capabilities specifically designed for analyzing coupled natural-human systems, enabling integrated water resource management simulations.

tools.name: superflexPy
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible framework for building hydrological models
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python framework that allows users to construct flexible and customized hydrological models, facilitating the testing of different model structures and hypotheses.

tools.name: WRF-WVTs
tools.one_line_profile: WRF model extension with water vapor tracers
tools.detailed_description: A modification of the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model that includes moisture tracers to track the origin and transport of water vapor in meteorological simulations.

tools.name: TauDEM
tools.one_line_profile: Terrain Analysis Using Digital Elevation Models
tools.detailed_description: A suite of Digital Elevation Model (DEM) tools for the extraction and analysis of hydrologic information from topography as represented by a DEM.

tools.name: eWaterCycle
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for running and coupling hydrological models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides a platform for running, coupling, and analyzing hydrological models, aiming to make hydrological modeling more reproducible and accessible.

tools.name: elapid
tools.one_line_profile: Species distribution modeling tools
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for species distribution modeling, including a re-implementation of Maxent, designed to handle geospatial data for ecological research.

tools.name: pyWRF-automation
tools.one_line_profile: Automation script for WRF model execution
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to automate the process of downloading GFS data and executing the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model, streamlining meteorological workflows.

tools.name: watershed-workflow
tools.one_line_profile: Workflows for watershed hydrological modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing workflows for data-rich, hyper-resolution simulations of hydrologic models on watersheds, facilitating data preparation and model setup.

tools.name: Prophet
tools.one_line_profile: Forecasting procedure for time series data with seasonality and trends
tools.detailed_description: A procedure for forecasting time series data based on an additive model where non-linear trends are fit with yearly, weekly, and daily seasonality, plus holiday effects. It works best with time series that have strong seasonal effects and several seasons of historical data.

tools.name: Kats
tools.one_line_profile: Kit to Analyze Time Series for forecasting, detection, and feature extraction
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, easy-to-use, generalizable, and extendable framework to perform time series analysis. It includes modules for forecasting, anomaly detection, change point detection, and feature extraction, suitable for environmental sensor data analysis.

tools.name: hydromad
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrological Model Assessment and Development
tools.detailed_description: An R package for hydrological modelling and assessment. It provides a framework for simulating rainfall-runoff processes and evaluating model performance against observed data.

tools.name: soothsayer
tools.one_line_profile: Elixir library for time series forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A time series forecasting library for Elixir, inspired by Facebook's Prophet and NeuralProphet. It allows for building forecasting models in Elixir-based data pipelines.

tools.name: GEOtop
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed model of the mass and energy balance of the hydrological cycle
tools.detailed_description: A distributed hydrological model that simulates the mass and energy balance of the hydrological cycle in continuum in small catchments, accounting for topography and soil interactions.

tools.name: CrossViVit
tools.one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal Context model for Solar Irradiance Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the CrossViVit model for improving day-ahead solar irradiance time series forecasting by leveraging spatio-temporal context from satellite data.

tools.name: ASTGCN-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Attention Based Spatial-Temporal Graph Convolutional Networks for Traffic Flow Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: PyTorch implementation of ASTGCN, a model for traffic flow forecasting that captures spatial-temporal dependencies using graph convolutional networks and attention mechanisms.

tools.name: HydPy
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for development and application of hydrological models
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed for the development, testing, and application of hydrological models. It supports various model structures and simplifies the process of handling hydrological data and simulations.

tools.name: LHMP
tools.one_line_profile: Lumped Hydrological Models Playground
tools.detailed_description: A collection of lumped hydrological models implemented in Python, serving as a tool for educational purposes and simple hydrological simulations.

tools.name: HydroShare
tools.one_line_profile: Collaborative platform for hydrologic data and model sharing
tools.detailed_description: The source code for HydroShare, a web-based system for sharing, publishing, and collaborating on hydrologic data and models. It enables the scientific community to manage and access water-related resources.

tools.name: hydroTSM
tools.one_line_profile: Time Series Management and Analysis for Hydrological Modelling
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for the management, analysis, plotting, and pre-processing of time series data used in hydrological modelling.

tools.name: CWatM
tools.one_line_profile: Community Water Model for global and local water cycle simulation
tools.detailed_description: CWatM (Community Water Model) is a hydrological model simulating the water cycle daily at global and local levels, historically and into the future. It is maintained by IIASA’s Water Security group and is designed to assess water supply, demand, and environmental needs.

tools.name: hbv_hydromodel
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the HBV Hydrological Model
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the HBV (Hydrologiska Byråns Vattenbalansavdelning) Hydrological Model, a conceptual model for simulating runoff based on precipitation and potential evaporation.

tools.name: pm-prophet
tools.one_line_profile: PyMC3-based implementation of Prophet for time series modeling
tools.detailed_description: A probabilistic time series modeling library inspired by Facebook Prophet but implemented using PyMC3. It allows for generalized additive models (GAM) with automatic changepoint detection, suitable for forecasting environmental time series data.

tools.name: HiPIMS-OCL
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance integrated modelling system for hydraulic/hydrological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance integrated modelling system designed for hydraulic and hydrological simulations. It leverages OpenCL for acceleration, enabling efficient simulation of flood dynamics and water flow on heterogeneous computing architectures.

tools.name: mHM
tools.one_line_profile: The mesoscale Hydrological Model
tools.detailed_description: A spatially explicit, distributed hydrological model that accounts for the spatial variability of meteorological inputs and terrain. It is designed for simulating hydrological processes such as soil moisture, evapotranspiration, and runoff at various scales.

tools.name: FOST
tools.one_line_profile: General forecasting tool for spatial-temporal and hierarchical data
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose forecasting tool developed by Microsoft, designed to handle complex forecasting domains including temporal, spatial-temporal, and hierarchical data. It aims to address the limitations of existing tools in processing structural graph data for spatial domains.

tools.name: fable.prophet
tools.one_line_profile: Fable extension for Prophet forecasting
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a wrapper for the Prophet forecasting procedure, allowing it to be used within the 'fable' framework for tidy time series analysis and forecasting.

tools.name: NASAaccess
tools.one_line_profile: NASA Earth observation data retrieval and formatting tool
tools.detailed_description: An R package that generates gridded ASCII tables of climate (CMIP5) and weather data (GPM, TRMM, GLDAS) specifically formatted to drive various hydrological models like SWAT, VIC, and RHESSys.

tools.name: scores
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for forecast verification and evaluation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library containing mathematical metrics for the verification, evaluation, and optimization of probabilistic and deterministic forecasts, primarily for weather and climate science applications.

tools.name: neuralhydrology
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for hydrology
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to train and evaluate deep neural networks for hydrological applications, such as rainfall-runoff modeling, with a focus on research reproducibility.

tools.name: diffusion_weather
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion models for weather and PV forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A repository implementing and exploring diffusion-based generative models specifically for weather forecasting and photovoltaic (PV) power generation prediction.

tools.name: graph_weather
tools.one_line_profile: Graph neural networks for global weather forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of graph neural network (GNN) based models for global weather forecasting, designed to process spherical weather data efficiently.

tools.name: GLOFRIM
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for integrated hydrological-hydrodynamic modelling
tools.detailed_description: A globally applicable framework that facilitates the coupling of various hydrological and hydrodynamic models (e.g., PCR-GLOBWB, Delft3D) to enable integrated simulation of water systems.

tools.name: wflow
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed hydrological modeling platform
tools.detailed_description: A distributed hydrological modeling platform that provides a set of modular concepts to simulate the water cycle, supporting various model concepts like sbm, hbv, and w3ra for flood forecasting and water management.

tools.name: NeuralProphet
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid forecasting framework based on PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly time series forecasting framework that bridges the gap between traditional decomposition models (like Prophet) and deep learning methods, supporting auto-regression, covariates, and events.

tools.name: dl-pbl
tools.one_line_profile: Domain-aware neural network emulation for planetary boundary layer parameterization
tools.detailed_description: A fast, domain-aware neural network emulation of planetary boundary layer (PBL) parameterization designed for numerical weather forecast models. Developed by researchers at Argonne National Laboratory.

tools.name: TopoFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Component-based spatial hydrologic modeling framework
tools.detailed_description: TopoFlow is a component-based, spatial hydrologic model that includes utilities for data preparation and visualization. It is designed to simulate hydrologic processes in a spatially distributed manner.

tools.name: TopoFlow (Old)
tools.one_line_profile: Obsolete version of the TopoFlow hydrologic model
tools.detailed_description: The obsolete version 3.5 of the TopoFlow spatial hydrologic model for Python 2.7. While superseded, it remains a scientific modeling tool.

tools.name: GlobalHydro
tools.one_line_profile: Global high-resolution hydrologic modeling data and code
tools.detailed_description: A repository for global high-resolution hydrologic modeling, covering 2.94 million river reaches with approximately 90m DEM resolution.

tools.name: Catchment Modelling Framework (cmf)
tools.one_line_profile: A modular framework for hydrologic modelling
tools.detailed_description: The Catchment Modelling Framework (cmf) is a toolbox for creating hydrologic models, allowing for flexible connection of water transport processes.

tools.name: PySHRED
tools.one_line_profile: Package for Shallow Recurrent Decoding of time-series sensors
tools.detailed_description: PySHRED is a Python package implementing Shallow Recurrent Decoding (SHRED), a method for sensing and reconstructing high-dimensional spatiotemporal fields from sparse sensor measurements.

tools.name: HYPEtools
tools.one_line_profile: R package for working with HYPE hydrological model files
tools.detailed_description: HYPEtools is an R package designed to facilitate the handling, analysis, and visualization of input and output files for the HYPE (Hydrological Predictions for the Environment) model.

tools.name: R.HydroTools
tools.one_line_profile: Computational tools for GIS and hydrological modeling
tools.detailed_description: A collection of computational tools for GIS, hydrological, and hydraulics computational design, modeling, and analysis.

tools.name: RavenR
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for Raven hydrologic modelling framework
tools.detailed_description: An R package for handling inputs, outputs, and diagnostics of the Raven hydrologic modelling framework.

tools.name: Merlion
tools.one_line_profile: A Machine Learning Framework for Time Series Intelligence
tools.detailed_description: Merlion is a Python library for time series intelligence. It provides an end-to-end machine learning framework that includes loading and transforming data, building and training models, post-processing model outputs, and evaluating model performance. It supports various time series learning tasks, including forecasting and anomaly detection, making it highly relevant for environmental monitoring data.

tools.name: pyWRF
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to process and plot data from the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model
tools.detailed_description: pyWRF is a Python-based utility designed to read, process, and visualize output data from the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model. It facilitates the analysis of meteorological data generated by WRF simulations, supporting tasks like data extraction and plotting.

tools.name: EXP-HYDRO
tools.one_line_profile: Catchment-scale hydrological model for daily streamflow simulation
tools.detailed_description: EXP-HYDRO is a Python implementation of a catchment-scale hydrological model designed for daily streamflow simulation. It serves as a tool for hydrological modeling, allowing researchers to simulate and predict water flow in river basins based on precipitation and evaporation data.

tools.name: Conformal Tights
tools.one_line_profile: Conformal prediction for scikit-learn regressors and Darts forecasters
tools.detailed_description: Conformal Tights is a library that adds conformal prediction capabilities to any scikit-learn regressor or Darts forecaster. It enables the generation of coherent quantiles and prediction intervals, providing rigorous uncertainty quantification for time series forecasting and regression models.

tools.name: LazyProphet
tools.one_line_profile: Time Series Forecasting with LightGBM wrapper
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies time series forecasting by wrapping LightGBM, allowing for efficient recursive forecasting with minimal code.

tools.name: Corrformer
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable Weather Forecasting with Unified Deep Model
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the Corrformer model for worldwide weather forecasting, as published in Nature Machine Intelligence, providing a unified deep learning approach for meteorological data.

tools.name: multi-prophet
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate forecasting with Facebook Prophet
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that encapsulates multivariate forecasting capabilities using Facebook Prophet, enabling easier handling of multiple time series.

tools.name: MARRMoT
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Assessment of Rainfall-Runoff Models Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox containing code for 47 conceptual hydrologic models, allowing for modular assessment and comparison of rainfall-runoff models.

tools.name: WRF
tools.one_line_profile: Weather Research and Forecasting Model
tools.detailed_description: A next-generation mesoscale numerical weather prediction system designed for both atmospheric research and operational forecasting applications.

tools.name: xwrf
tools.one_line_profile: Xarray interface for WRF model output
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python interface for working with the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model output using Xarray, facilitating data analysis and visualization.

tools.name: PyTorchTS
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic time series forecasting framework based on PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: PyTorchTS is a probabilistic time series forecasting library built on top of PyTorch and GluonTS. It provides state-of-the-art deep learning models for forecasting complex temporal dynamics, making it suitable for environmental monitoring tasks such as weather prediction and pollution concentration forecasting.

tools.name: CEVAE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep latent-variable model for causal effect inference
tools.detailed_description: A TensorFlow implementation of the Causal Effect Variational Autoencoder (CEVAE), designed to estimate causal effects from observational data by leveraging deep latent-variable models to adjust for confounding.

tools.name: CATENets
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network-based estimators for Conditional Average Treatment Effects
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing Scikit-learn compatible implementations of various neural network-based methods for estimating Conditional Average Treatment Effects (CATE), including S-Learner, T-Learner, TARNet, and DragonNet.

tools.name: causallib
tools.one_line_profile: Modular causal inference analysis and model evaluation tool
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for causal inference, providing a modular API for estimating treatment effects using various statistical and machine learning models, along with tools for model evaluation and validation.

tools.name: pycirk
tools.one_line_profile: Modeling Circular Economy policy interventions in Input-Output Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to model Circular Economy policy and technological interventions within Environmentally Extended Input-Output Analysis (EEIOA), specifically tailored for use with mrSUTs (EXIOBASE).

tools.name: CausalRivers
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark package for causal discovery on river data
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark package and dataset for evaluating causal discovery methods using real-world time series data from river networks, facilitating the comparison of algorithms in environmental science contexts.

tools.name: VLTimeSeriesCausality
tools.one_line_profile: Variable-lag Granger causality and transfer entropy inference
tools.detailed_description: A framework for inferring causality between pairs of time series using Variable-lag Granger causality and transfer entropy, suitable for analyzing temporal dependencies in complex systems.

tools.name: YLearn
tools.one_line_profile: All-in-one causal learning and inference package
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for causal inference that supports various aspects of the causal learning process, including causal discovery, treatment effect estimation, and policy evaluation.

tools.name: DoubleML-Python
tools.one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning framework in Python
tools.detailed_description: The Python implementation of the Double Machine Learning framework, enabling the estimation of causal effects using machine learning methods while accounting for high-dimensional nuisance parameters.

tools.name: DoubleML-R
tools.one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning framework in R
tools.detailed_description: The R implementation of the Double Machine Learning framework, providing tools for causal inference and treatment effect estimation using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: DoubleML-Serverless
tools.one_line_profile: Serverless architecture extension for distributed Double Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the DoubleML library that enables distributed Double Machine Learning calculations using a serverless architecture, facilitating scalable causal inference.

tools.name: CausalDiscoveryToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive Python package for causal inference and graph structure recovery
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for causal inference in graphs and pairwise settings, including tools for graph structure recovery and dependency analysis.

tools.name: GenomicSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Structural equation modeling tool for GWAS summary statistics
tools.detailed_description: An R package for structural equation modeling based on GWAS summary data, allowing for the analysis of multivariate genetic architecture.

tools.name: Causality Lab
tools.one_line_profile: Causal discovery algorithms and experimentation platform
tools.detailed_description: A collection of causal discovery algorithms and tools for implementing and benchmarking new ones, developed by Intel Labs.

tools.name: dsem
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic structural equation models for spatial and temporal data
tools.detailed_description: An R package for fitting dynamic structural equation models, particularly useful for spatial and temporal data analysis in ecology and environmental science.

tools.name: Associations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia algorithms for associations, independence testing, and causal inference
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing algorithms for quantifying associations, performing independence tests, and conducting causal inference from data.

tools.name: CSLE
tools.one_line_profile: Cyber Security Learning Environment for developing automated security policies
tools.detailed_description: A research platform to develop automated security policies using quantitative methods such as reinforcement learning, game theory, and causal inference.

tools.name: TCDF
tools.one_line_profile: Temporal Causal Discovery Framework for discovering causal relationships in time series
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for discovering causal relationships between time series data, utilizing attention-based convolutional neural networks.

tools.name: CATEs
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning estimation of heterogeneous causal effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing methods for the machine learning estimation of heterogeneous causal effects (CATEs).

tools.name: causalDML
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of Double Machine Learning for causal inference
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Double Machine Learning methods for causal inference, facilitating robust estimation of causal effects.

tools.name: dmlmt
tools.one_line_profile: R package for Double Machine Learning with Multiple Treatments
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Double Machine Learning (DML) methods specifically designed for scenarios involving multiple treatments. It facilitates causal inference by combining machine learning predictive models with econometric techniques to estimate treatment effects.

tools.name: cause2e
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end causal analysis pipeline in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the entire causal analysis workflow, from causal discovery to effect estimation. It provides a high-level interface for performing end-to-end causal inference on datasets.

tools.name: sherlock
tools.one_line_profile: Causal machine learning for segment discovery
tools.detailed_description: An R package developed by Netflix for causal machine learning, specifically focused on segment discovery and analysis to identify heterogeneous treatment effects.

tools.name: ucate
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty in Conditional Average Treatment Effect Estimation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for estimating uncertainty in Conditional Average Treatment Effect (CATE) predictions, developed by the Oxford Applied and Theoretical Machine Learning Group.

tools.name: RiskStratifiedEstimation
tools.one_line_profile: Risk-stratified treatment effect estimation
tools.detailed_description: An R package from OHDSI for evaluating treatment effect heterogeneity using a risk-based approach, allowing for the assessment of how treatment effects vary across different risk strata.

tools.name: OpenASCE
tools.one_line_profile: Open All-Scale Causal Engine for large-scale causal learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for end-to-end large-scale causal learning, providing algorithms for causal discovery, causal effect estimation, and attribution.

tools.name: OpenMx
tools.one_line_profile: Extended Structural Equation Modeling
tools.detailed_description: A powerful and flexible R package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM), allowing for the specification, estimation, and analysis of a wide variety of statistical models.

tools.name: SyntheticControlMethods
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference using Synthetic Control Methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing Synthetic Control Methods for causal inference, useful for estimating the effect of interventions in comparative case studies.

tools.name: bicycle
tools.one_line_profile: Intervention-Based Causal Discovery with Cycles
tools.detailed_description: A library for causal discovery that can handle cyclic graphs using intervention data, useful for biological and complex system modeling.

tools.name: CImpact
tools.one_line_profile: Causal inference library for time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by Sanofi for performing causal inference on time series data, enabling the assessment of interventions in temporal datasets.

tools.name: StructuralEquationModels.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and flexible Structural Equation Modelling in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) that emphasizes performance and flexibility, allowing for the definition and estimation of complex latent variable models.

tools.name: fast-causal-inference
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance causal inference computing library based on OLAP
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance causal inference (statistical model) computing library based on OLAP, designed to solve performance bottlenecks of existing statistical model libraries (R/Python) under big data scenarios.

tools.name: Granger-causality
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient implementation of Granger causality and its extensions
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing efficient implementations of Granger causality and its extensions, developed by the USC Melady Lab.

tools.name: nlpsem
tools.one_line_profile: R package for analyzing nonlinear longitudinal processes in SEM
tools.detailed_description: An R package for analyzing nonlinear longitudinal processes within the structural equation modeling (SEM) framework, suitable for complex causal modeling.

tools.name: pyGC
tools.one_line_profile: Granger Causality library in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to performing Granger Causality tests on time series data.

tools.name: tfcausalimpact
tools.one_line_profile: Python Causal Impact Implementation using TensorFlow Probability
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Google's Causal Impact algorithm (originally in R), built using TensorFlow Probability for estimating causal effects of interventions on time series.

tools.name: mlcausality
tools.one_line_profile: Nonlinear Granger causality using machine learning techniques
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for estimating nonlinear Granger causality using machine learning techniques, such as Kernel Ridge Regression.

tools.name: PyCausality
tools.one_line_profile: Predictive causality between time series using information-theoretic techniques
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to calculate predictive causality between time series using information-theoretic techniques like Transfer Entropy.

tools.name: psmpy
tools.one_line_profile: Propensity score matching in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for propensity score matching (PSM), facilitating causal inference by balancing covariates in observational data.

tools.name: causalnlp
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for causal inference with text
tools.detailed_description: A practical toolkit for causal inference where text is used as a treatment, outcome, or controlled-for variable.

tools.name: causeinfer
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning based causal inference/uplift in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for machine learning-based causal inference and uplift modeling, providing standard algorithms for treatment effect estimation.

tools.name: causalDisco
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for causal discovery in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing tools and algorithms for causal discovery from data.

tools.name: causalforge
tools.one_line_profile: Suite of modeling & causal inference methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing a suite of modeling and causal inference methods using machine learning algorithms, developed by Anthem AI (Elevance Health).

tools.name: asympPDC
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB package for Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) estimation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB and Octave package for Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) and Directed Transfer Function (DTF) estimation with asymptotic statistics, used for Granger Causality analysis.

tools.name: linearmodels
tools.one_line_profile: Linear models including instrumental variable and panel data models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that extends statsmodels with additional linear models, specifically focusing on instrumental variable (IV) models and panel data models for econometrics and causal inference.

tools.name: kmatch
tools.one_line_profile: Stata module for multivariate-distance and propensity-score matching
tools.detailed_description: A Stata package implementing various matching methods for causal inference, including multivariate-distance matching, propensity-score matching, entropy balancing, and inverse probability weighting.

tools.name: drtmle
tools.one_line_profile: Doubly-robust nonparametric estimators for average treatment effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides nonparametric estimators of the average treatment effect with doubly-robust confidence intervals and hypothesis tests, utilizing targeted minimum loss-based estimation (TMLE).

tools.name: DeepSCM
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Structural Causal Models for counterfactual inference
tools.detailed_description: A framework for Deep Structural Causal Models (DeepSCM) that enables tractable counterfactual inference by combining deep learning with structural causal models, particularly for medical imaging and other high-dimensional data.

tools.name: causal-text-embeddings
