tools.one_line_profile: Python library for creating maps with OpenStreetMap data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the creation of maps using OpenStreetMap data, suitable for geospatial visualization and analysis.

tools.name: GeoHD
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for geospatial hotspot detection and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for geospatial hotspot detection, visualization, and analysis using urban data, aiding in spatial pattern recognition.

tools.name: AQuA2
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tool for molecular spatiotemporal signals
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for Activity Quantification and Analysis (AQuA) of molecular spatiotemporal signals, particularly useful in analyzing dynamic biological events.

tools.name: Incremental_Kriging_Assisted_Evolutionary_Algorithm
tools.one_line_profile: Kriging-assisted evolutionary algorithm for optimization
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a fast Kriging-assisted evolutionary algorithm based on incremental learning, useful for computationally expensive optimization problems in engineering and science.

tools.name: INCREASE
tools.one_line_profile: Inductive Graph Representation Learning for Spatio-Temporal Kriging
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the INCREASE model, which uses inductive graph representation learning for spatio-temporal Kriging, enabling interpolation in spatial data.

tools.name: pretty_gpd
tools.one_line_profile: Utility for plotting GeoPandas dataframes
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python utility function to enhance the plotting capabilities of GeoPandas dataframes, facilitating quick geospatial data visualization.

tools.name: DetectorFreeSfM
tools.one_line_profile: Detector-Free Structure from Motion pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of a detector-free Structure from Motion (SfM) pipeline, used for 3D reconstruction from 2D images, applicable in geosciences and photogrammetry.

tools.name: HydroDesktop
tools.one_line_profile: Open source GIS-enabled desktop application for hydrologic and climate data management
tools.detailed_description: HydroDesktop is a free and open source GIS enabled desktop application that helps users search for, download, visualize, and analyze hydrologic and climate data registered with the CUAHSI Hydrologic Information System. It serves as a client for discovering and accessing water data services.

tools.name: SMPL-Fitting
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for fitting SMPL body models to 3D scans
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation for fitting the SMPL statistical body model to 3D scan data, commonly used in anthropometry, biomechanics, and computer vision research for analyzing human body shape and pose.

tools.name: dash_doodler
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive web tool for image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A web application built with Plotly Dash for semi-supervised image segmentation, designed for labeling scientific imagery such as geological or environmental scans with minimal supervision.

tools.name: environmental-impact-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for environmental impact analysis
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python tools developed by Esri for scientists and planners to analyze and report the potential impact of development projects on the natural environment.

tools.name: FEMlium
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of FEM simulations on maps
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that combines Finite Element Method (FEM) simulation results with Folium to create interactive geographic visualizations of physical simulations.

tools.name: PyEarthScience
tools.one_line_profile: Climate science data processing and visualization scripts
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts and notebooks from DKRZ (German Climate Computing Center) for processing and visualizing climate science data, utilizing libraries like PyNGL, xarray, and Cartopy.

tools.name: KnowFlow_AWM
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source water quality monitoring system
tools.detailed_description: An open-source hardware and software tool for automatic water monitoring, enabling the collection of water quality data for environmental research.

tools.name: NCL
tools.one_line_profile: Scripting language for the analysis and visualization of climate and weather data
tools.detailed_description: The NCAR Command Language (NCL) is a scripting language specifically designed for the analysis and visualization of climate and weather data. It supports various scientific data formats like NetCDF, GRIB, and HDF, and provides high-quality graphics for scientific publications.

tools.name: cf-view
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for exploring and plotting netCDF and Met Office format data
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for exploring, analyzing, and plotting environmental data stored in netCDF and Met Office PP formats. Developed by the National Centre for Atmospheric Science (NCAS), it aids in the quick inspection of climate and meteorological datasets.

tools.name: zarr-cesium
tools.one_line_profile: CesiumJS providers for visualizing environmental Zarr data
tools.detailed_description: A library that provides CesiumJS providers for interactive 2D and 3D visualization of environmental and geospatial data stored in the Zarr format. Developed by the National Oceanography Centre, it facilitates web-based visualization of cloud-native scientific data.

tools.name: PAVICS-SDI
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial Data Infrastructure for climate science analytics and visualization
tools.detailed_description: PAVICS-SDI (Power Analytics and Visualization for Climate Science - Spatial Data Infrastructure) is a platform developed by Ouranos to provide infrastructure for climate data analysis and visualization. It integrates various OGC standards and tools to support climate science workflows.

tools.name: Geo Data Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: VSCode extension for visualizing geospatial data formats (GeoJSON, KML, etc.)
tools.detailed_description: A Visual Studio Code extension that allows users to view and interact with geospatial data files directly within the editor using Kepler.gl, facilitating quick inspection and visualization of scientific map data.

tools.name: bs4Dash
tools.one_line_profile: Bootstrap 4 dashboard library for R Shiny applications
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a Bootstrap 4 dashboard template for Shiny, enabling researchers and data scientists to build modern, responsive web-based dashboards for scientific data reporting and visualization.

tools.name: shinyMobile
tools.one_line_profile: Mobile-ready framework for R Shiny applications
tools.detailed_description: An R package built on top of Framework7 that allows the creation of mobile-optimized Shiny apps, facilitating field data collection and mobile visualization of scientific data.

tools.name: shinydashboardPlus
tools.one_line_profile: Extensions for the shinydashboard R package
tools.detailed_description: An extension package for 'shinydashboard' that adds more components and features (like improved sidebars, boxes, and widgets), enhancing the capabilities of R-based scientific dashboards.

tools.name: ClimateSERV2
tools.one_line_profile: Climate data visualization and download tool by SERVIR
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by SERVIR (NASA/USAID) that allows development practitioners and scientists to visualize and download historical rainfall, vegetation condition data, and forecasts to support decision-making in agriculture and water availability.

tools.name: GPS Map Visualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to plot GPS coordinates from CSV on interactive maps
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to visualize GPS coordinate data from CSV files onto interactive maps with clustering capabilities, useful for visualizing field data or sensor locations.

tools.name: Sensor Data Logger
tools.one_line_profile: Android Wear app for logging and plotting sensor data
tools.detailed_description: An application for Android Wear devices to log and visualize sensor data (accelerometer, gyroscope, etc.), useful for scientific data gathering and preliminary visualization in field studies.

tools.name: golem
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building robust production-grade R Shiny apps
tools.detailed_description: An opinionated framework for building production-grade Shiny applications, providing tools for structure, deployment, and module management, widely used for developing scientific dashboards and tools in R.

tools.name: uxarray
tools.one_line_profile: Xarray extension for unstructured climate and weather data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that extends Xarray to support the analysis and visualization of unstructured grid data, commonly found in climate and global weather modeling.

tools.name: Monitor My Watershed
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for sharing and visualizing environmental IoT data
tools.detailed_description: A web platform enabling users to upload, share, and visualize environmental monitoring data (IoT sensors) based on the ODM2 data system, supporting watershed research and management.

tools.name: AgroSphere
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of climate change effects on agriculture
tools.detailed_description: A web application that visualizes global agriculture and weather station data to demonstrate the effects of climate change, serving as a tool for educational and research visualization.

tools.name: environment.monitor
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for continuous tracking of environmental components
tools.detailed_description: A solution designed to provide a comprehensive interface for tracking and evaluating environmental health and component availability over time.

tools.name: shinyjqui
tools.one_line_profile: jQuery UI interactions for R Shiny applications
tools.detailed_description: An R package that brings jQuery UI interactions (like drag-and-drop, resizing, and sorting) to Shiny apps, enhancing the interactivity of scientific dashboards.

tools.name: localtileserver
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic tile server for visualizing geospatial rasters in Jupyter
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables visualization of large geospatial raster datasets in Jupyter notebooks using ipyleaflet or folium. It acts as a bridge between raster data and interactive map visualizations, essential for environmental and geospatial analysis.

tools.name: cccharts
tools.one_line_profile: R package for visualizing climate change indicators and environmental data
tools.detailed_description: An R package developed by the BC Government to create standardized, publication-ready data visualizations for climate change indicators. It provides functions to generate specific chart types used in environmental reporting.

tools.name: rthreejs
tools.one_line_profile: Three.js 3D visualization widgets for R and Shiny
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to the Three.js JavaScript library, enabling the creation of interactive 3D scatter plots, globes, and graph visualizations directly from R. It is widely used for scientific data visualization in R workflows.

tools.name: prettymapp
tools.one_line_profile: Webapp and Python tool to create maps from OpenStreetMap data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool and Streamlit webapp that allows users to generate aesthetic maps from OpenStreetMap data. It is useful for creating geospatial visualizations for reports and presentations.

tools.name: streamlit-keplergl
tools.one_line_profile: Streamlit component for rendering Kepler.gl maps
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that integrates Kepler.gl, a powerful open-source geospatial analysis tool, into Streamlit applications. It enables researchers to build interactive dashboards for large-scale geospatial data visualization.

tools.name: cloud-sustainability-dashboard
tools.one_line_profile: Dashboard for optimizing cloud environmental sustainability
tools.detailed_description: A dashboard tool designed to help organizations measure and visualize the carbon footprint and environmental impact of their cloud infrastructure usage, supporting sustainability reporting and optimization.

tools.name: hockeystick
tools.one_line_profile: R package to download and visualize global heating data
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides easy access to essential climate change datasets (e.g., CO2, global temperature) and functions to visualize them, facilitating climate data analysis and communication.

tools.name: Dekart
tools.one_line_profile: Backend for Kepler.gl enabling large-scale geospatial data visualization
tools.detailed_description: Dekart is an open-source backend for Kepler.gl that allows for the visualization of large-scale geospatial datasets directly from databases like BigQuery and Athena. It is designed to handle heavy map visualizations that are critical in environmental monitoring and geographic information science (GIS).

tools.name: mapa-streamlit
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for creating 3D-printable models of earth surface from geospatial data
tools.detailed_description: A Streamlit-based web application that utilizes the mapa library to generate 3D-printable STL models of the Earth's surface based on user-selected regions and topography data.

tools.name: RAGxplorer
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems
tools.detailed_description: An open-source tool designed to visualize the document chunks and retrieval processes in RAG systems, helping researchers understand embedding spaces and retrieval quality.

tools.name: geeViz
tools.one_line_profile: Google Earth Engine visualization libraries for geospatial analysis
tools.detailed_description: A repository of Google Earth Engine (GEE) libraries produced by the US Forest Service, providing tools for visualizing and analyzing geospatial data related to environmental monitoring.

tools.name: geemap
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive geospatial analysis and visualization with Google Earth Engine
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for interactive mapping with Google Earth Engine, ipyleaflet, and ipywidgets, enabling users to analyze and visualize Earth observation data interactively in Jupyter environments.

tools.name: eefolium
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Python package for Earth Engine mapping with Folium
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library that integrates Google Earth Engine with Folium for interactive map visualization, serving as a simpler alternative to geemap for specific mapping tasks.

tools.name: Panel
tools.one_line_profile: High-level Python library for creating interactive scientific dashboards and web apps
tools.detailed_description: Panel is an open-source Python library that lets you create custom interactive web apps and dashboards by connecting user-defined widgets to plots, images, tables, or text. It is part of the HoloViz ecosystem and is widely used in scientific computing to visualize data from libraries like Xarray, Pandas, and various plotting backends.

tools.name: iSEE
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive SummarizedExperiment Explorer for genomic data visualization
tools.detailed_description: iSEE provides an interactive Shiny interface for exploring data stored in SummarizedExperiment objects. It is designed for bioinformatics applications, allowing researchers to visualize and analyze transcriptomics and other omics data without writing code.

tools.name: teal
tools.one_line_profile: Shiny-based framework for analyzing clinical trial data
tools.detailed_description: teal is a framework for building interactive web applications for the analysis of clinical trial data. It provides a set of modules and tools to visualize and explore CDISC-compliant data, facilitating the reporting and analysis process in pharmaceutical research.

tools.name: CO2-Gadget
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced firmware for ESP32-based CO2 and environmental monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A firmware solution for ESP32 microcontrollers that transforms them into advanced CO2 and environmental monitors. It supports real-time data visualization, logging, and various communication protocols (BLE, WIFI, MQTT) for environmental data collection.

tools.name: ecological-inference
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for ecological inference statistical methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of ecological inference, a statistical process used to infer individual-level behavior from aggregate data. While named 'ecological', it is primarily a statistical method used in social sciences and demographics.

tools.name: TagAnomaly
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly detection analysis tool for multiple time series
tools.detailed_description: An R-based tool designed for anomaly detection analysis and labeling, specifically tailored for handling multiple time series data. It allows users to detect anomalies in categorical time series data, useful for environmental monitoring and sensor data analysis.

tools.name: UrbanReflex
tools.one_line_profile: Smart city platform for environmental monitoring and infrastructure management
tools.detailed_description: An open-source smart city platform that integrates environmental monitoring, infrastructure status, and citizen reports. It transforms road segments into linked data nodes and uses AI for classification and prioritization of urban issues.

tools.name: hexapod-robot-simulator
tools.one_line_profile: First-principles hexapod robot simulator
tools.detailed_description: A simulator for hexapod robots built from first principles, allowing for the study of kinematics, gait analysis, and robotic movement. Useful for robotics research and physics simulation.

tools.name: canvasXpress
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for scientific data analytics and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A standalone JavaScript library for data analytics and visualization, widely used in bioinformatics and genomics. It supports complex visualizations like heatmaps, boxplots, and network diagrams with full audit trail capabilities.

tools.name: MONET
tools.one_line_profile: Model and Observation Evaluation Toolkit for atmospheric composition
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit developed by NOAA to evaluate atmospheric composition models (like CMAQ, CAMx) against observational data, facilitating verification and analysis of air quality models.

tools.name: explainerdashboard
tools.one_line_profile: Library to build interactive dashboards for explaining machine learning models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that allows users to quickly build interactive dashboards to explain the inner workings of machine learning models, including feature importance, shapley values, and individual predictions, useful for scientific model interpretation.

tools.name: openairmaps
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to create interactive maps of air pollution data
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to create interactive maps for air pollution data analysis, integrating with the openair ecosystem to visualize spatial distribution of pollutants.

tools.name: leafmap
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for interactive mapping and geospatial analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for interactive mapping and geospatial analysis with minimal coding in a Jupyter environment, supporting various basemaps and data formats for environmental monitoring.

tools.name: streamlit-geospatial
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-page Streamlit application for geospatial analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive web application built with Streamlit that provides a suite of tools for geospatial analysis and visualization, allowing users to visualize vector/raster data without writing code.

tools.name: Dash.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface for the Dash analytical web application framework
tools.detailed_description: The Julia interface to the Dash ecosystem, enabling the creation of analytical web applications and dashboards for scientific data visualization using Julia.

tools.name: Dash
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building analytical web applications in Python
tools.detailed_description: A productive Python framework for building web analytic applications, widely used in the scientific community for creating interactive dashboards and visualizing complex datasets.

tools.name: Dash Cytoscape
tools.one_line_profile: Component for interactive network visualization in Dash
tools.detailed_description: A Dash component for creating interactive network visualizations, powered by Cytoscape.js, suitable for visualizing biological networks, ecological interactions, and other graph data.

tools.name: Dash Deck
tools.one_line_profile: Component for large-scale geospatial visualization in Dash
tools.detailed_description: A library that integrates deck.gl and pydeck into Dash, enabling high-performance, large-scale geospatial data visualization for scientific applications.

tools.name: psyplot
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization framework for Earth system science data (NetCDF/Unstructured grids)
tools.detailed_description: Psyplot is a Python package built on matplotlib and xarray, specifically designed for the interactive visualization of data on the sphere, such as climate and weather data stored in NetCDF format. It supports unstructured grids and integrates with the Jupyter ecosystem.

tools.name: Plastic Origins
tools.one_line_profile: AI-powered river plastic pollution detection and mapping platform
tools.detailed_description: A citizen science project and tool that uses artificial intelligence to detect and map plastic litter on river banks from video feeds, aiding in the monitoring of riverine pollution.

tools.name: vayu
tools.one_line_profile: Domain-specific visualization library for air quality data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed specifically for creating high-quality, domain-standard visualizations for air quality monitoring, such as pollution roses and calendar plots.

tools.name: topicwizard
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization library for interpreting topic models (LDA, NMF, BERTopic)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an interactive interface for visualizing and interpreting topic models. It allows researchers to explore topic distributions, word relevance, and document-topic relationships, facilitating the analysis of textual data in social and environmental sciences.

tools.name: ggedit
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive editor for ggplot2 layer aesthetics and themes
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides an interactive GUI for editing ggplot2 plot aesthetics and theme definitions. It helps researchers fine-tune scientific visualizations without manually adjusting complex code parameters.

tools.name: Terra
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal spatio-temporal dataset and benchmark spanning the Earth
tools.detailed_description: Terra is a multimodal spatio-temporal dataset and benchmark designed for Earth system modeling. It integrates various data sources to support research in environmental monitoring and climate science.

tools.name: Oil-Spill-Detection-SAR
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning workflow for oil spill detection using synthetic SAR data
tools.detailed_description: A project demonstrating oil spill detection in synthetic SAR imagery. It includes tools for generating synthetic datasets with speckle noise and spill regions, and a U-Net model for segmentation.

tools.name: Satellite-Image-Captioning-Model
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic satellite imagery captioning workflow
tools.detailed_description: Generates captions for synthetic satellite imagery using machine learning. It provides a benchmark-ready dataset and modeling workflow for testing satellite image captioning.

tools.name: Wetland-Classification-GEE-CNN
tools.one_line_profile: Wetland classification workflow using synthetic spectral features
tools.detailed_description: Employs synthetic spectral and index features to classify land into water, wetland, and upland. Demonstrates a workflow combining remote sensing concepts with deep learning.

tools.name: aq-biascorrection
tools.one_line_profile: Bias correction tool for CAMS air quality model predictions
tools.detailed_description: A tool for bias correction of air quality CAMS model predictions by using OpenAQ observations. Developed by ECMWF Code for Earth.

tools.name: eo4ai
tools.one_line_profile: Earth Observation dataset preprocessing tools for Deep Learning
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools for preprocessing Earth Observation datasets to make them suitable for Deep Learning applications, developed by ESA Phi-Lab.

tools.name: Dataset4EO
tools.one_line_profile: Platform and library for Earth Observation datasets
tools.detailed_description: Official repository for the EarthNets Platform, providing access and tools for various Earth Observation datasets.

tools.name: RSI-Classification
tools.one_line_profile: Remote Sensing Image Classification tools
tools.detailed_description: Tools and models for Image/Scene Classification in Remote Sensing Images, part of the EarthNets Platform.

tools.name: RSI-Detection
tools.one_line_profile: Remote Sensing Object Detection tools
tools.detailed_description: Tools and models for Object Detection in Remote Sensing Images, part of the EarthNets Platform.

tools.name: RSI-Segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Remote Sensing Semantic Segmentation tools
tools.detailed_description: Tools and models for Semantic Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images, part of the EarthNets Platform.

tools.name: TFNet-ESC
tools.one_line_profile: Time-Frequency Network for Environmental Sound Classification
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning method (TFNet) for environmental sound classification that uses temporal and frequency attention mechanisms to enhance features from audio signals.

tools.name: SustainDC
tools.one_line_profile: Data Center simulation and control environment
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python environments for Data Center simulation and control using Heterogeneous Multi Agent Reinforcement Learning, focusing on sustainability and energy optimization.

tools.name: SustainCluster
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark environment for sustainable workload scheduling
tools.detailed_description: A high-fidelity Gymnasium environment for benchmarking multi-objective, sustainable workload scheduling across geo-distributed data centers, integrating energy, carbon, and weather data.

tools.name: Sustain-LC
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking environment for data center controls
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking environment for traditional, reinforcement learning, and LLM-based controls in data centers, focusing on sustainability.

tools.name: IUCNN
tools.one_line_profile: Neural networks for predicting species conservation status
tools.detailed_description: A tool to train neural networks based on geographic species occurrences, environmental data, and IUCN Red List assessments to predict the conservation status of species.

tools.name: WBLCA Benchmark V2 Data

tools.detailed_description: A public repository containing data collected and prepared for the CLF WBLCA Benchmark Study V2. It includes building design characteristics, life cycle inventories, and environmental impact assessment results for 292 building projects in North America.

tools.name: gval

tools.detailed_description: A high-level Python framework developed by NOAA-OWP to evaluate the skill of geospatial datasets. It compares candidate datasets to benchmark maps to produce agreement maps and metrics, facilitating rigorous validation of geospatial models.

tools.name: PredBench

tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark for evaluating spatio-temporal prediction models across various scientific disciplines, including weather forecasting and environmental monitoring. It provides standardized datasets and metrics for comparing model performance.

tools.name: ClimART

tools.detailed_description: A large-scale dataset designed for benchmarking machine learning models that emulate atmospheric radiative transfer in weather and climate models. It enables the development of faster and more accurate climate simulations.

tools.name: GeoBenchX
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for LLM agents on multi-step geospatial tasks
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to evaluate Large Language Model (LLM) agents on complex, multi-step geospatial tasks. It includes an LLM-as-Judge evaluation framework to assess tool usage and reasoning in geospatial contexts.

tools.name: Weather Data Analytics Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for frequency-based analysis of extreme climate events
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based framework for modeling and benchmarking occurrences of extreme climate events, such as extreme temperature and precipitation. It employs empirical cumulative distribution functions (ECDF) for learning and prediction phases.

tools.name: GEO-Bench-VLM
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Vision-Language Models on geospatial tasks
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark specifically designed to evaluate the performance of Vision-Language Models (VLMs) on various geospatial tasks, facilitating the development of multi-modal AI for earth sciences.

tools.name: SDGi Corpus Benchmarks
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarks for text classification by Sustainable Development Goals
tools.detailed_description: A multilingual dataset and benchmark suite for classifying text according to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Developed by UNDP, it supports policy science and environmental text analysis.

tools.name: CY-Bench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for subnational crop yield forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive dataset and benchmark for forecasting crop yields at the subnational level. It standardizes the selection, processing, and spatio-temporal harmonization of public yield statistics with relevant predictors for agricultural modeling.

tools.name: mbDenoise
tools.one_line_profile: Microbiome data denoising using zero-inflated probabilistic PCA
tools.detailed_description: An accurate and robust method for denoising microbiome count matrices. It uses a zero-inflated probabilistic PCA (ZIPPCA) model to handle zero-inflation, unequal sequencing depth, and overdispersion in microbiome data, recovering true abundance levels.

tools.name: TetWild
tools.one_line_profile: Robust tetrahedral meshing for simulation
tools.detailed_description: A robust tool for generating tetrahedral meshes from arbitrary triangle soups. While general-purpose, it is a critical solver for scientific simulations (finite element analysis) in physics and engineering contexts.

tools.name: ClimateLearn
tools.one_line_profile: Library for accessing climate data and benchmarking ML models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to streamline the process of accessing climate datasets and benchmarking machine learning models for weather and climate tasks. It provides standard baselines and data loaders.

tools.name: SentinelDataDownloaderTool
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Sentinel satellite data downloader for AI datasets
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts utilizing the Google Earth Engine Python API to automate the creation of datasets from Sentinel satellite imagery, facilitating the preparation of Earth Observation data for AI applications.

tools.name: AiTLAS Arena
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark framework for Earth Observation image classification
tools.detailed_description: An open-source benchmark framework for evaluating state-of-the-art deep learning approaches for image classification tasks in Earth Observation (EO). It enables standardized comparison of models on EO datasets.

tools.name: py-openaq
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for accessing OpenAQ air quality data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides a wrapper for the OpenAQ API, facilitating the retrieval and integration of global air quality data for environmental research.

tools.name: EarthNet Minicuber
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating EarthNet minicubes for vegetation forecasting
tools.detailed_description: Official utility tool for the EarthNet challenge to create and process 'minicubes' (spatio-temporal data cubes) used in geospatial vegetation forecasting benchmarks.

tools.name: EarthNet Models PyTorch
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning models for EarthNet vegetation forecasting benchmark
tools.detailed_description: A collection of PyTorch implementations of deep neural networks specifically designed for the EarthNet geospatial vegetation forecasting challenge.

tools.name: WeatherBench 2
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for next-generation data-driven global weather models
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating data-driven global weather forecasting models, providing standardized datasets, metrics, and baselines.

tools.name: WeatherBenchX
tools.one_line_profile: Modular framework for evaluating weather forecasts
tools.detailed_description: A modular framework designed to evaluate weather forecasts, extending WeatherBench with additional capabilities for model comparison and metric calculation.

tools.name: StationBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking weather forecasts against station observations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for benchmarking weather forecast models specifically against ground station observations, providing tools for data alignment and metric computation.

tools.name: airPy
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating AI-ready air quality datasets from Earth Engine
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to generate AI-ready datasets for air quality and Earth Observation studies by interfacing with Google Earth Engine.

tools.name: WeatherReal-Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation pipelines for weather forecast verification
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite providing evaluation pipelines and components to support the WeatherReal dataset, designed for verifying and benchmarking weather forecasting models against real-world data.

tools.name: WILDS
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark of in-the-wild distribution shifts for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark package for evaluating machine learning models on distribution shifts, including datasets and metrics for environmental and ecological tasks (e.g., iWildCam for animal monitoring, PovertyMap for satellite imagery analysis).

tools.name: WeatherBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset and baseline models for data-driven weather forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite for evaluating data-driven weather forecasting models, providing pre-processed datasets (ERA5), evaluation metrics, and baseline model implementations.

tools.name: WEATHER-5K
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale benchmark for global station weather forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite and dataset for next-generation global station weather forecasting, including time-series data and evaluation protocols.

tools.name: So2Sat-LCZ42
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for global Local Climate Zones (LCZ) classification
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark dataset consisting of Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 satellite imagery for the classification of Local Climate Zones (LCZ). It supports research in urban climate modeling and remote sensing by providing labeled data for training and evaluating machine learning models.
